definition: to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: A man's reputation may be sacrifice in a moment of ill-considered action.
sentences.chinese: 一个人的声誉可能断送在考虑欠周的那一瞬间。
无能的经营管理断送了公司。

sentences.english: Boobies were almost ruined for me today.
sentences.chinese: 鲣鸟，几乎断送了我的今天。

sentences.english: Development will be devastated by drought and famine.
sentences.chinese: 干旱和饥荒将断送促进发展的事业。

sentences.english: The greatest disaster is to take your rivals lightly; Taking them lightly nearly cost me my treasures.
sentences.chinese: 最大的祸害是轻敌，轻敌几乎能断送我的宝贝。

sentences.english: The fallout claimed two of the highest-flying companies of the time.
sentences.chinese: 泡沫破裂断送了当时最有雄心的两家公司。

sentences.english: His sprained ankle ruined his chances of winning the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他扭伤了足踝，这断送了他赢得比赛的机会。

definition: to hold a funeral procession and burial/to give sb a final send-off/(fig.) to ruin (one's future prospects etc)
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
to destroy
to come to nothing (idiom)
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to snatch away
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
momentary slip/false step/ill-considered action
life
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
future (career etc) prospects
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
wasted effort
to save/to remedy/to rescue
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
to strangle/to throttle
